markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 6"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Phase Out](/Feats.aspx?ID=2914) <actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Evolution" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=394" />
<trait label="Summoner" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=392" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 70 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Using the Phase Out summoner ability means that your eidolon cannot make any Strikes, nor can it take any actions requiring a physical form_

**Prerequisites**
your eidolon is a [phantom](/Traits.aspx?ID=361)

</column>

---

Your eidolon phases out of reality slightly, gaining resistance to all damage (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75) and [negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118)) equal to half your level. It's not [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222), but it can't use Strikes or actions that require a fully physical form, such as [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35), [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=38), or [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40). Your eidolon can return to its normal form with a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait.
name: Phase Out

text: <title level="1" right="Feat 6" pfs="Standard" > Phase Out Three Actions Source Secrets of Magic pg. 70 1.1 PFS Note Using the Phase Out summoner ability means that your eidolon cannot make any Strikes, nor can it take any actions requiring a physical form Prerequisites your eidolon is a phantom --- Your eidolon phases out of reality slightly, gaining resistance to all damage (except force and negative) equal to half your level. It's not incorporeal, but it can't use Strikes or actions that require a fully physical form, such as Grapple, Shove, or Trip. Your eidolon can return to its normal form with a single action, which has the concentrate trait.
